member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.AdviseKeyEventSink
member.summary: Installs a key event sink to receive keyboard events.
member.param: Identifier of the client that owns the key event sink. This value is obtained by a previous call to .
Pointer to a interface.

Specifies if this key event sink is made the foreground key event sink. If this is TRUE, this key event sink is made the foreground key event sink. Otherwise, this key event sink does not become the foreground key event sink.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.
The client identified by tid has a key event sink installed.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.GetForeground
member.summary: Obtains the class identifier of the foreground TSF text service.
member.param: Pointer to a CLSID that receives the class identifier of the foreground TSF text service.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: There is no foreground text service.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.GetPreservedKey
member.summary: Obtains the command GUID for a preserved key.
member.param: Pointer to the application context. This value is returned by a previous call to .

Pointer to a structure that identifies the preserved key to obtain. The uVKey member contains the virtual key code and the uModifiers member identifies the modifiers of the preserved key. The uVKey member must be less than 256.
Pointer to a GUID value that receives the command GUID of the preserved key. This is the GUID passed in the TSF text service call to . This value receives GUID_NULL if the preserved key is not found.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The method was successful and the preserved key was found.
The method was successful, but the preserved key was not found. pguid receives GUID_NULL.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.GetPreservedKeyDescription
member.summary: Obtains the description string of an existing preserved key.
member.param: Contains the command GUID of the preserved key.
Pointer to a BSTR value the receives the description string. The caller must free this memory using SysFreeString.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters is invalid or the preserved key is not found.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.IsPreservedKey
member.summary: Determines if a command GUID and key combination is a preserved key.
member.param: Specifies the command GUID of the preserved key. This is the GUID passed in the text service call to .

Pointer to a structure that identifies the preserved key. The uVKey member contains the virtual key code and the uModifiers member identifies the modifiers of the preserved key. The uVKey member must be less than 256.
Pointer to a BOOL that receives TRUE if the command GUID and key combination is a registered preserved key, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The method was successful and the preserved key was found.
The method was successful, but the preserved key was not found.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.KeyDown
member.summary: Passes a key down event to the keystroke manager.
member.param: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event was handled and the event should not be forwarded to the application. If this value is FALSE, the key event was not handled and the event should be forwarded to the application.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: There are no key event sinks installed.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.KeyUp
member.summary: Passes a key up event to the keystroke manager.
member.param: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event will be handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event would be handled and the event should not be forwarded to the application. If this value is FALSE, the key event would not be handled and the event should be forwarded to the application.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: No key event sinks are installed.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.PreserveKey
member.param: Contains the client identifier of the TSF text service. This value is passed to the TSF text service in its method.
Contains the command GUID of the preserved key. This value is passed to the TSF text service method to identify the preserved key when the preserved key is activated.
Pointer to a structure that specifies the preserved key. The uVKey member contains the virtual key code and the uModifiers member identifies the modifiers of the preserved key.
Pointer to a Unicode string that contains the description of the preserved key. This cannot be NULL unless cchDesc is zero.
Specifies the number of characters in pchDesc. Pass zero for this parameter if no description is required.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.SetPreservedKeyDescription
member.summary: Modifies the description string of an existing preserved key.
member.param: Contains the command GUID of the preserved key.
Pointer to a Unicode string that contains the new description of the preserved key. This cannot be NULL unless cchDesc is zero.
Number of characters in pchDesc. Pass zero for this parameter if no description is required.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: One or more parameters are invalid or the preserved key is not found.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.SimulatePreservedKey
member.summary: Simulates the execution of a preserved key sequence.
member.param: Pointer to the application context. This value was returned by a previous call to .
Contains the command GUID of the preserved key.
Pointer to a BOOL that indicates if the key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event was handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event was not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The preserved key cannot be simulated.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.TestKeyDown
member.summary: Determines if the keystroke manager will handle a key down event.
member.param: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

Pointer to a BOOL that indicates if the key event would be handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event would be handled and the event should not be forwarded to the application. If this value is FALSE, the key event would not be handled and the event should be forwarded to the application.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: There are no key event sinks installed.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.TestKeyUp
member.summary: Determines if the keystroke manager will handle a key up event.
member.param: Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Pointer to a BOOL that indicates if the key event is handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event is handled and the event should not be forwarded to the application. If this value is FALSE, the key event is not handled and the event should be forwarded to the application.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: No key event sinks are installed.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.UnadviseKeyEventSink
member.param: Identifier of the client that owns the key event sink. This value was passed when the advise sink was installed using .

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The advise sink identified by tid was not found.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr.UnpreserveKey
member.param: Contains the command GUID of the preserved key.
Pointer to a structure that specifies the preserved key. The uVKey member contains the virtual key code and the uModifiers member identifies the modifiers of the preserved key.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The preserved key is not registered.
One or more parameters are invalid.

member.name: ITfKeystrokeMgr
member.summary: The ITfKeystrokeMgr interface is implemented by the TSF manager and used by applications and text services to interact with the keyboard manager.
